definition: to look, smile, etc. in a particular direction
to make light, a shadow, etc. appear in a particular place
to say, do or suggest something that makes people doubt something or think that somebody is less honest, good, etc.
to vote for somebody/something
to choose actors to play the different parts in a film, play, etc.; to choose an actor to play a particular role
to describe or present somebody/yourself in a particular way
to throw one end of a fishing line into a river, etc.
to throw somebody/something somewhere, especially using force
when a snake casts its skin, the skin comes off as part of a natural process
if a horse casts a shoe, the shoe comes off by accident
to shape hot liquid metal, etc. by pouring it into a hollow container (called a mould)
to look at or examine something quickly
to make a problem, etc. easier to understand
to make a problem, etc. easier to understand
to make yourself think about something that happened in the past
to consider a lot of different people, activities, possibilities, etc. when you are looking for something
to use words that are thought to be magic and have the power to change or influence somebody/something
used to say that an event has happened or a decision has been made that cannot be changed

to use a method of choosing somebody/something that involves putting a number folded pieces of paper in a bag, one of them with a mark on it. People then take it in turns to take a piece of paper from the bag and the one who takes the paper with the mark on it is chosen.
to stop caring about how dangerous something might be; to start taking risks
used in polite offers or invitations
used to say what you like, love, hate, etc.
used as the past form of will when reporting what somebody has said or thought
used for talking about the result of an event that you imagine
used for describing a possible action or event that did not in fact happen, because something else did not happen first
used for saying why somebody does something
used for saying what you want to happen
used to show that somebody/something was not willing or refused to do something
used to ask somebody politely to do something
used to give opinions that you are not certain about
used to give advice
used for talking about things that often happened in the past
used for talking about behaviour that you think is typical
used to express a strong wish
often
a sports event that has been arranged to take place on a particular date and at a particular place
a thing such as a bath or toilet that is fixed in a house and that you do not take with you when you move house
a very small spot; a small piece of dirt, etc.
a type of poisonous gas used in chemical weapons
archer (= a person who shoots with a bow and arrows)
the state of being extremely tired or ill, either physically or mentally, because you have worked too hard
the point at which a rocket has used all of its fuel and has no more power
an indoor game for two people or teams, played by moving rows of small models of football (soccer) players in order to move a ball on a board that has marks like a football (soccer) field
a metal stand that you can put a hot dish, etc. on
used to say ‘there it is!’ when you show something to somebody, or something appears suddenly
a road vehicle without an engine that is pulled by a car, designed for people to live and sleep in, especially when they are on holiday
a covered vehicle that is pulled by a horse and used for living in
a group of people with vehicles or animals who are travelling together, especially across the desert
a line of people or vehicles that move along slowly, especially as part of a ceremony; the act of moving in this way
a number of people who come one after the other
